msbt.message: Yo, ! Glad to have you in the audience.
Yep. It'll be good to have a witness as I turn into my guinea pig.
Wait, you told me this was an audition. I brought 200 head shots!Be straight with me—has the part already been cast?
No, trust meyou're the star of this show.
Wellalright!

OK, so I got invited to one of those fancy parties. You know, with cups that aren't made of plastic? AndI don't really know what to do with myself in that kind of scene. What do I do with my hands? So I thought maybe I could practice with you guys a little bit. Work on talking to fancy folks. So hurry up and pretend to be fancy!
Ha HA! Fancy-party guy? That's the role I was BORN to play.<10_4 /> Alright, let me get into character
No time for that! I'm startingUhhey, . What brings you to this fancy party?
Well, thank you for asking, fellow partygoer!I'm actually a world-famous food stylist. Just go with it, !So, I'm helping make sure the host can tell the hors d'oeuvres from the hors d'on'ts, you see.
Yeah, yeah, cool, whatever.<10_4 /> Did that feel right? I was trying to blow you off. Hey, I think I'm ready! This has been super helpful!<20_2 arg="8" />Sorry I didn't have a bigger part for you, .
So, I've never been any good at saying goodbye to folks.I don't mean, like, goodbye forever. Just, like, saying goodbye when I'm done hanging out with someone. So, here is gonna help me practice.
Well, if anything, I'm overqualified for this part. But, as always, I will studiously prepare—<10_8 arg="40" />
Great, great. OK, let's go. This is the part where you start saying goodbye. Go on—say it!
Dearest , it has been a pleasure, but now I must take my leave of you—<10_8 arg="30" />
'K, bye.<10_4 /> Wow, that was kinda fun. I think I nailed it! Feels way better than just ghosting folks too. Think I'll try it more often. BUH-BYE!

See, I've got to practice talking to my parents. It's always so awkward when they ask me questions. It's always like, "What are you doing with your life?" and "Why won't you tell us where you live?" Ugh! Anyway, I want you to pretend that you're my dad. You got that, ?
Now, dear, your mother and I are both very proud of you, but we're curious—
Oh, this is too real.Cut it out, ! I'm pulling the plug on this experiment!
Now, darlingjust hear us out
Yeah, Dad. Whatever you sayI think I got it! Just mumble and agree whenever they ask anything!Thanks, guys. This really helped.
Hey, Mom! What's for dinner?
Microwaved , what else?<10_4 /> WAIT. Did you just call me MOM?!

Oh! Sorry, I'm just getting into character for this audition.I assume I'll be playing your child, thanks to my boyish good looks.Anyway, back to my question, if we're having that for dinner, can we have for dessert?
I am not your MOTHER and this is really creeping me out!AlsoTHIS ISN'T AN AUDITION!
Don't you know? Life's an audition, ! Embrace it.<20_2 arg="6" />Did you record that? I want to use it for my reel.
You're about to be canceled, so I wouldn't worry about your reel right now, !

<20_2 arg="6" />Hey, everyone. Thanks for coming to this live performance of my untitled one-man interpretive dance. <20_2 arg="5" />But before we get started, I just need to let you know that I don't work for free, . Your presence indicates that you agree to having your likeness used on promotional T-shirts.
Nope! I'm not falling for that one again. My face is already on waaaaay too many T-shirts. Don't ask. But wait. What was that thing you said? , was it?<10_4 /> Itactually kinda rocked.

Ha HA! Reel 'em in with the , then hook 'em with the interpretive dance. Works every time. So, what size T-shirt should I put you down for?Trick question. I only ordered XW— that's extra wide—so that I could fit my entire website link on them.

First, that's not how T-shirts work. Second, that's not how fishing works. Third, and most importantly <10_10 />Put my face on a T-shirt at your own risk, !<10_9 />Wow! That felt great. And saying really added some spice to my threat. I think I'll keep on using it!
Alright, alrightno T-shirts.<10_4 /> But could you at least watch me dance?
